question.questionText: The drawing above shows a plaza in the afternoon. Label the west side of the drawing with a W. Label the north side of the drawing with an N. How did you know which direction was west?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: In the afternoon, shadows point east because the Sun is in the west. So the west side is opposite of the shadows.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Because the person the north side has the longest shadow and the fountain on the west and the tree have the west shadow.
I knew which direction was north, so I figured that west was to the left.
Because I remember a compass rose and west is on the left side.
I know which direction is west because west always points at the opposite direction.
